name: St. Hildegard of Bingen
summary: Hildegard of Bingen was a German Benedictine abbess, mystic, composer, writer, and polymath. She is one of the best-known composers of sacred monophony and wrote theological, botanical, and medicinal texts, as well as letters, liturgical songs, and poems. She experienced mystical visions from a young age and documented them in her major works. She was declared a Doctor of the Church in 2012, making her one of only four women to hold this title.

writings.title: Liber Divinorum Operum (Book of Divine Works)
